action.action-desc: Mr. Burgess introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To amend section 416 of title 39, United States Code, to remove the authority of the United States Postal Service to issue semipostals except as provided for by an Act of Congress, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Semipostal Stamp Clarification Act of 2017.

section.header: Limitation on United States Postal Service semipostal stamp authority
section.text: Section 416 of title 39, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subsection (b) and inserting the following:

subsection.text: The Postal Service may issue and sell semipostals under this section only for such purposes or causes as provided for by an Act of Congress.

clause.text: by striking appropriate agency or agencies and inserting appropriate agency or entity, as provided for by an Act of Congress pursuant to subsection (b),; and
by striking such agency and inserting such agency or entity;

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsections (f) and (g) as subsections (e) and (f), respectively.
